Cell.Data: Entry
Category
Category
Question
Answer
New Customer
Licensing Options
My organization plans to upgrade 5 or more existing PCs to Windows 8 through Volume Licensing.

If your existing PCs have Qualifying Operating Systems, you can purchase the Windows 8 Pro Upgrade licenses from a Microsoft reseller through a Microsoft Volume Licensing program. Depending on the Volume Licensing program you select, Software Assurance is either included or optional.
Volume Licensing: Pricing and Part Numbers
What is the pricing for Windows 8, and how do I purchase through Volume Licensing?

For organizations with five or more PCs, Microsoft offers significant cost savings on Windows 8 Pro Upgrade licenses through Microsoft Volume Licensing. To learn more about pricing through Volume Licensing see the Microsoft License Advisor or contact a Microsoft reseller for more details.
What are the Windows 8 part numbers through Volume Licensing?
To learn more about part numbers and pricing contact a Microsoft reseller.
Installation, Upgrades, Activation
Installation
What are the system requirements for Windows 8?
Please refer to the Windows 8 system requirements.
Where can I find assistance with Deployment Planning?
Online resources for deployment planning are available via TechNet.
Where can I find assistance with installation?
Online resources for installation guidance can be found via TechNet.
Upgrades
My organization plans to upgrade 5 or more existing PCs to Windows 8 through Volume Licensing.

If your existing PCs have Qualifying Operating Systems, you can purchase the Windows 8 Pro Upgrade licenses from a Microsoft reseller through a Microsoft Volume Licensing program. Depending on the Volume Licensing program you select, Software Assurance is either included or optional.
Activation
How do I activate Windows on devices purchased through Volume Licensing?

When acquired through Volume Licensing, Windows 8 can be activated through Key Management Service (KMS), Active Directory-based activation, or Multiple Activation Key (MAK) activation. To learn more about Volume Activation, visit the Volume Activation Overview.
Product Keys
How do I obtain product keys in Volume Licensing?

Product Keys for Volume Licensing are provided through the Volume Licensing Service Center or the Microsoft Volume License Key department (888-352-7140). For software obtained outside of Microsoft Volume Licensing, Product Keys will come with the software.
How do I obtain replacement Volume Licensing product keys if I lost my key or it does not work?
For Volume License customers who need to replace a Product Key because it is lost or does not work, please call the Microsoft Volume License Activation Center (888) 352-7140.
Software Assurance
What are the benefits of Software Assurance?
Customers with Software Assurance for Windows receive unique benefits. For general Software Assurance benefit information, please visit the Microsoft Software Assurance site.
How do I purchase Software Assurance?

Software Assurance is an optional addition to any Windows 8 Pro upgrade license purchased through Volume Licensing. When you purchase Windows 8 Pro preinstalled on a new device, you can add Software Assurance through a Microsoft Volume Licensing program within 90 of the device purchase date. Contact a Microsoft reseller for details and pricing.
How do I activate Software Assurance benefits?
Software Assurance benefits can be activated through the Volume Licensing Service Center. For additional information, see the Software Assurance FAQ located on the VLSC home page.
Existing Customer
Licensing Information
My company has existing devices with prior versions of Windows
My company has devices covered under Software Assurance. What licensing is required to run Windows 8?
Through the New Version Rights benefit of Software Assurance, you are licensed to upgrade any devices covered by active Software Assurance for Windows to Windows 8 Enterprise.
My company has devices that are not covered under Software Assurance. What licensing is required to run Windows 8?

For existing PCs with Qualifying Operating Systems, Windows 8 Pro Upgrade licenses may be purchased from a Microsoft reseller through a Microsoft Volume Licensing program. Depending on the Volume Licensing program you select, Software Assurance is either included or optional.
Volume Licensing: Pricing and Part Numbers
What is the pricing for Windows 8, and how do I purchase through Volume Licensing?

For organizations with five or more PCs, Microsoft offers significant cost savings on Windows 8 Pro Upgrade licenses through Microsoft Volume Licensing. To learn more about pricing through Volume Licensing, see the Microsoft License Advisor or contact a Microsoft reseller for further details.
What are the Windows 8 part numbers through Volume Licensing?
To learn more about part numbers and pricing, contact a Microsoft reseller.
Software Assurance
What are the benefits of Software Assurance?
Customers with Software Assurance for Windows receive unique benefits. For general Software Assurance benefit information, please visit the Microsoft Software Assurance site.
How do I purchase Software Assurance?

Software Assurance is an optional addition to any Windows 8 Pro upgrade license purchased through Volume Licensing. When you purchase Windows 8 Pro preinstalled on a new device, you can add Software Assurance through a Microsoft Volume Licensing program within 90 of the device purchase date. Contact a Microsoft reseller for details and pricing.
How do I activate Software Assurance benefits?
Software Assurance benefits can be activated through the Volume Licensing Service Center. For additional information, see the Software Assurance FAQ located on the VLSC home page.
Fulfillment through Volume Licensing
Where can I download Windows 8?
Volume Licensing customers can download Windows 8 through the Volume Licensing Service Center.
Where can I get new or replacement copies of Windows 8 disc media (DVD)?

Windows 8 disc media can be obtained through the Media hotline for Open License customers (1-800-336-0098). For Enterprise Agreement, Select, Select Plus, and Enrollment for Education Solutions, media can be obtained through the associated LAR.
Installation, Upgrades, Activation
Installation
What are the system requirements for Windows 8?
Please refer to the Windows 8 System Requirements.
Where can I find assistance with Deployment Planning?
Online resources for deployment planning are available via TechNet.
Where can I find assistance with installation?
Online resources for installation guidance can be found via TechNet.
Upgrades
How do I upgrade devices that are covered under Software Assurance through Volume Licensing?

You are licensed to upgrade any devices covered by active Software Assurance for Windows to Windows 8 Enterprise through the New Version Rights benefit of Software Assurance. Software Assurance customers can download Windows 8 through the Volume Licensing Service Center.
How do I upgrade devices that are not covered under Software Assurance through Volume Licensing?

For existing PCs with Qualifying Operating Systems, you can purchase the Windows 8 Pro Upgrade licenses from a Microsoft reseller through a Microsoft Volume Licensing program. Depending on the Volume Licensing program you select, Software Assurance is either included or optional.
Activation
How do I activate Windows on devices purchased through Volume Licensing?

When acquired through Volume Licensing, Windows 8 can be activated through Key Management Service (KMS), Active Directory-based activation, or Multiple Activation Key (MAK) activation. To learn more about Volume Activation visit the Volume Activation Overview.
Product Keys
How do I obtain product keys in Volume Licensing?

Product Keys for Volume Licensing are provided through the Volume Licensing Service Center or the Microsoft Volume License Key department (888-352-7140). For software obtained outside of Microsoft Volume Licensing, Product Keys will come with the software.
How do I obtain replacement Volume Licensing product keys if I lost my key or it does not work?
For Volume License customers who need to replace a Product Key because it is lost or does not work, please call the Microsoft Volume License Activation Center (888-352-7140).
Benefits of Volume Licensing for Windows 8
Cost Savings
Volume Licensing is the most cost effective way for commercial customers to purchase Windows upgrades.
Access to Exclusive Offerings

Volume Licensing provides access to offerings not available through other channels - for example, Windows 8 Enterprise Edition and the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP), which are not available through OEM or FPP channels.
Flexibility

Volume Licensing customers receive more flexible use rights than those that come with an OEM or FPP license (e.g. downgrade rights to prior versions). When Software Assurance for Windows is added, customers have even greater flexibility for how they use Windows, such as virtualization and Windows To Go rights.
Downgrade and Reimaging Rights
If I need to use a prior version of Windows, what are my options?

For Windows 8 Pro licenses acquired through an OEM, downgrade rights are limited to the equivalent edition for the two prior versions. For Windows licenses acquired through Volume Licensing, downgrade rights provide the greatest flexibility with downgrades to any prior version.

Refer to the Downgrade Rights Volume Licensing Brief for further information.
I need to deploy a custom image of Windows across my organization. What are my options?
To learn more about custom images, reference the Reimaging Rights Volume Licensing Brief.
Flexibility with Software Assurance (SA)
My employees need to access Windows at home or on the road
My employee is the primary user of a device licensed under Software Assurance for Windows or a Windows Virtual Desktop Access (VDA) subscription.

The user can access a corporate Windows desktop from a personally owned device either through Virtual Desktop Infrastructure or by running Windows To Go on the device at no additional cost through the Roaming Use Rights benefit of Software Assurance/Windows VDA subscription.

To learn more about flexible work options, please reference the Windows 8 Licensing Guide.
My employee is not the primary user of a device licensed under Software Assurance for Windows or a Windows Virtual Desktop Access (VDA) subscription.

First, license the user's primary device under Software Assurance for Windows or with a Windows VDA subscription license. The user can then access a corporate Windows desktop from a personally owned device either through the Virtual Desktop Infrastructure or via Windows To Go on the device through the Roaming Use Rights benefit of Software Assurance/Windows VDA subscription.

To learn more about flexible work options, please reference the Windows 8 Licensing Guide.
My employees need to access Windows across multiple devices

First, license the user's primary device under Software Assurance for Windows or with a Windows VDA subscription license. To license the companion device for accessing a corporate desktop through Virtual Desktop Infrastructure or via Windows To Go, the appropriate license depends on the device type. For a corporate owned Windows RT companion device, no additional license is needed. For an x86 device, license the device with Software Assurance for Windows or Windows VDA Subscription. For other devices, attach the Windows Companion Subscription License (CSL).

To learn more about flexible work options, please reference the Windows 8 Licensing Guide.
My employees bring their own devices to work

My employee is the primary user of a device that is licensed with Software Assurance for Windows or a Windows Virtual Desktop Access (VDA) subscription. He/she also wants to bring a personal device into work and use it to access a Windows desktop image through VDI or run Windows To Go.

Attach the Windows Companion Subscription License (CSL) to the underlying Software Assurance or Windows VDA license. As the primary user of the licensed device with Software Assurance or Windows VDA subscription, with the attached Windows CSL, that employee can access a corporate desktop at work through Virtual Desktop Infrastructure or by running Windows To Go on up to four companion devices.

To learn more about flexible work options, please reference the Windows 8 Licensing Guide.
My employee is not the primary user of a device licensed with Software Assurance for Windows or a Windows Virtual Desktop Access (VDA) subscription.

License the employee’s personally-owned device with Software Assurance for Windows, if the device is already licensed with a Qualifying Operating System or Windows Virtual Desktop Access (VDA) subscription.

For additional devices, add the Windows Companion Subscription License, which allows the primary user of the device licensed with Software Assurance for Windows or Windows VDA subscription to access a corporate desktop at work through Virtual Desktop Infrastructure or via Windows To Go on up to four companion devices.

To learn more about flexible work options, please reference the Windows 8 Licensing Guide.
What are the key benefits of Software Assurance?
Customers with Software Assurance for Windows receive unique benefits. For general Software Assurance benefit information, please visit the Microsoft Software Assurance site.
